Quick Facts

EXIT   X

SUSPICIOUS AND THRESHOLD TRANSACTIONS

Page

Table of Contents

 

Your organisation must give additional details in a TTR when an individual conducts the transaction on a customer's behalf.  

 

An individual may be considered the customer if:

 

•         the transaction appears to be regular

•         the individual has not denied being the customer

•         all other information reinforces that the individual is the customer

 

To determine if an individual is conducting the threshold transaction on a customer's behalf, you should consider whether:

 

•         an account is held in a business or company name

•         the customer is familiar to staff in your organisation

•         the person's physical appearance differs from their account details (for example, differences in age or gender)

•         a transaction is inconsistent with the customer's known financial profile or previous activity

•         a transaction is made somewhere not normally associated with the customer (for example, a withdrawal from interstate)
